QuestionJSON.Question: Jessie loves American football and statistics. They are working on a project to collect and analyze football statistics for their Computer Science course. Jessie has data like scores, team names, player information, and duration of games. They want to devise a novel way to represent this data using multiple encoding schemes. Which of the following is unlikely to benefit Jessie in effectively presenting the data?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Using scatter plot to show correlation between duration of games and scores.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Using bar chart to show the number of games won by each team.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Using pie chart to show percentage distribution of player positions in a team.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Using a heat map to showcase the computer science concepts used in the project.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: While all the options are encoding schemes, a heat map to showcase the computer science concepts used in the project is unlikely to provide meaningful insights relating to the football statistics data.
